content.raw: I think real time factor is defined as the ratio of simulation time versus clock time, say we set the simulation time step dt = 0.001 seconds, then we run for 1000 time steps, but due to our collision detection, or solver computation time, then the wall clock time for simulating 1000 time steps is 1.2 second, the real time factor would be 0.001*1000/1.2, which is slower than real time. Correct me if anything not accurate @scpeters
content.html: I think real time factor is defined as the ratio of simulation time versus clock time, say we set the simulation time step dt = 0.001 seconds, then we run for 1000 time steps, but due to our collision detection, or solver computation time, then the wall clock time for simulating 1000 time steps is 1.2 second, the real time factor would be 0.001*1000/1.2, which is slower than real time. Correct me if anything not accurate @scpeters
